alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 11:25AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Haskell, northwestern Shackelford and western Throckmorton Counties through 1230 PM CST... At 1125 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Lake Stamford Marina, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Millers Creek Reservoir, Irby, Us-183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line and The Intersection Of Us-380 And Highway 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
